get.description: This operation lists the supported contact types. Administrators should use the values from this operation to add or update a user's `contactType`. Users should run the [View contact types for a user profile](ref:get-user-contact-types) operation before modifying their contact type.

200.description: The response provides the supported contact types.

get.description: This operation lists the supported countries. Administrators should use the values from this operation to add or update a user's `country`. Users should run the [View supported countries for a user profile](ref:get-user-countries) operation before modifying their country.

200.description: The response provides the supported countries.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Filters the results by country, but only returns lists of states and provinces for `USA` and `Canada`.

get.description: This operation lists the supported U.S. states or Canadian provinces. Administrators should use the values from this operation to add or update a user's `state`. If a user's state or province is unknown, use `TBD`. Users should run the [View states for a user profile](ref:get-user-states) operation before modifying their state.

200.description: The response provides the supported U.S. states or Canadian provinces.

get.description: This operation lists the products a user can subscribe to and receive notifications for on the account. The tokens in your API client determine the account. Administrators should use the values from this operation to set a user's product notifications. Users should run the [View products for a user profile](ref:get-user-notification-products) operation before setting their product notifications.

200.description: The response provides the supported products.

example: Secure FreeFlow (HTTPS Content Delivery using ARLs)

get.description: This operation lists the password policy for the account. The tokens in your API client determine the account. Administrators should use the values from this operation to set a user's password policy. Users should run the [View password policy for a user profile](ref:get-user-password-policy) operation before setting their password policy.

200.description: The response provides the password policy.

schema.description: Encapsulates all information for a password policy.

minLength.description: The minimum length of a password.

caseDif.description: The number of characters that, at minimum, need to be in a different case. For example, a value of 1 means at least one letter needs to be uppercase if the rest are lowercase.

maxRepeating.description: The maximum allowed number of repeating characters.

minDigits.description: The minimum number of digits in a password.

minLetters.description: The minimum number of letters in a password.

minNonAlpha.description: The minimum number of non-alphabetic characters in a password.

minReuse.description: The minimum number of previous passwords to retain to prevent password reuse.

pwclass.description: Unique identifier for a password policy.

rotateFrequency.description: The number of days a password is valid.

get.description: This operation lists the supported languages. Administrators should use the values from this operation to set a user's `preferredLanguage`. Users should run the [View languages for a user profile](ref:get-user-languages) operation before setting their preferred language.

200.description: The response provides the supported languages.

get.description: This operation returns the supported session timeout policies an administrator can use when [creating](ref:post-ui-identity) and [updating](ref:put-ui-identity-basic-info) user profiles. The `name` for each timeout period is in minutes, and the time `value` is in seconds. Make sure to select a value that's equal or smaller to the **Max session timeout** value, set for your account in the Identity and Access Management interface's [Settings](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/account-settings) tab. Users should run the [View timeout policies for a user profile](ref:get-user-timeout-policies) operation before setting their timeout policy.

200.description: This operation lists the supported session timeout policies.

schema.description: Specifies session timeout policy options that can be assigned to each user.

items.description: Specifies session timeout policy options that can be assigned to each user.

name.description: The unit of time in which the timeout is measured. The timeout is measured in seconds.

value.description: The number of seconds until the timeout.

get.description: This operation lists the supported time zones in the ISO 8601 format. Administrators should use the values from this operation to set a user's `timeZone`. Users should run the [View time zones for a user profile](ref:get-user-timezones) operation before setting their time zone.

200.description: The response provides the supported time zones.

schema.description: Specifies time zones that can be assigned to each user.

items.description: Specifies time zones that can be assigned to each user.

description.description: The description of a time zone, including the GMT +/-.

offset.description: The time zone offset from GMT.
